column4: I have a Western Digital  160G usb hard drive that has continual problems with mounting on Ubuntu9.10  ...very temperamental!  I finally got an error message that says: Unable to mount, exit code 13 NTFS_attr_pread  ...failed to read first NTFS_BLOCK_SIZE bytes of potential restart page. ...and then goes on about suggesting doing chkdsk /f with winxp. Can anyone help with this?
Did you do the chkdsk?
..well, not this time (yet), but I have done it plenty of times and I continue to have problems with it. The same was happening on 9.04  ..it's bugging the hell out of me!
You've got filesystem corruption.  Do the chkdsk, and then mount the USB drive with the sync option.
could you explain the sync option to me please? ...or point me to where I can find out?  I haven't heard of that before
After that, always unmount the USB drive through the right-click menu.
..but it mounts by itself of course.
It is an option that you can put in the /etc/fstab and is documented by `man mount`.  I don't remember where to put it for removable media.

ok, that's completely foreign to me, but I'll have a look. When you say to mount with right click menu. Where from?   ...usually, if the drive won't be mounted, it doesn't show up anywhere. Not even with 'blkid' from Terminal.
The removable disk should appear in the left-side pane of the Nautilus fie manager, and on your desktop.  Right click the drive from either of those places.
The right-click context menu should have a umount or eject option.  Doing this before you pull the USB connection prevents filesystem glitches.
yes, it does when it's recognised,. but when it 'un-mounts' it also disappears from desktop and from nautilus!!
And when that happens, the disk is safe to unplug.
yes, but if the drive isn't visible, then you can't use right-click menu. That's the problem I'm having. The system doesn't even 'see' the drive!
Don't ignore error messages and follow my advice.  Go run the chkdsk command.
The filesytem is borked.  It won't appear again until you fix it according to the error message.
haha, yes!  :)   ...I will do it, yet again!!   ...aaahhhhh  :/
..it usually works for at least a few minutes again after I do chkdsk ....but problem returns very quickly again. Drive still works ok on Windows!  :/
If the disk disconnects or disappears when you're using it on the Ubuntu computer, then you've got a second problem.  You'll need to watch the /var/log/messages file for more information.
If the USB drive has a power plug, then use it and the problem may stop happening.
aaahh, actually, someone did suggest using the double usb connector!!  ...I forgot about that. Still need to try that one!
